018package org.tquadrat.foundation.value;
019
020import static java.util.Arrays.stream;
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNotEmptyArgument;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
024
025import java.math.BigDecimal;
026
027import org.apiguardian.api.API;
028import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
029import org.tquadrat.foundation.value.api.DimensionWithLinearConversion;
030
031/**
032 *  The various instances of masses and weights (although this is not really
033 *  the same, from a physical or scientific point of view ...).
034 *
035 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
036 *  @version $Id: Mass.java 995 2022-01-23 01:09:35Z tquadrat $
037 *  @since 0.1.0
038 *
039 *  @UMLGraph.link
040 */
041@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Mass.java 995 2022-01-23 01:09:35Z tquadrat $" )
042@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
043public enum Mass implements DimensionWithLinearConversion
044{
045        /*------------------*\
046    ====** Enum Declaration **=================================================
047        \*------------------*/
048    /**
049     *  A milligram.
050     */
051    MILLIGRAM( new BigDecimal( "0.000001" ), "mg" ),
052
053    /**
054     *  An English grain. This unit is still in use to define the mass of
055     *  firearm bullets, arrow heads, or the explosives load for firearm
056     *  cartridges.
057     */
058    GRAIN( new BigDecimal( "0.00006479891" ), "gr." ),
059
060    /**
061     *  A metric carat; this is defined as 0.2&nbsp;g; although no unit sign is
062     *  officially defined, the use of &quot;ct&quot; is widely accepted. That
063     *  is why we use it here as well.
064     */
065    CARAT( new BigDecimal( "0.0002" ), "ct" ),
066
067    /**
068     *  A gram.
069     */
070    GRAM( new BigDecimal( "0.001" ), "g" ),
071
072    /**
073     *  A dram (Avoirdupois), a 1/16 of an
074     *  {@linkplain #OUNCE ounce}.
075     */
076    DRAM( new BigDecimal( "0.001771845195312500" ), "dr." ),
077
078    /**
079     *  An ounce (Avoirdupois), a 1/16 of a
080     *  {@linkplain #POUND pound}.
081     */
082    OUNCE( new BigDecimal( "0.028349523125" ), "oz." ),
083
084    /**
085     *  A troy ounce (same as <i>Apothecaries Ounce</i>, as used for precious
086     *  metal.
087     */
088    TROY_OUNCE( new BigDecimal( "0.0311034768" ), "oz.tr." ),
089
090    /**
091     *  An imperial pound (Avoirdupois), 7000
092     *  {@linkplain #GRAIN grain}.
093     */
094    POUND( new BigDecimal( "0.45359237" ), "lb." ),
095
096    /**
097     *  A kilogram.
098     */
099    KILOGRAM( BigDecimal.ONE, "kg" ),
100
101    /**
102     *  <p>{@summary A stone; although abandoned since 1985, it will still be used in some
103     *  Commonwealth countries to determine the body weight.}</p>
104     *  <p>1&nbsp;st&nbsp;=&nbsp;14&nbsp;{@linkplain #POUND lb.}&nbsp;=&nbsp;224&nbsp;{@linkplain #OUNCE oz.}&nbsp;=&nbsp;3584&nbsp;{@linkplain #DRAM dr.}</p>
105     */
106    STONE( new BigDecimal( "6.35029318" ), "st" ),
107
108    /**
109     *  A short ton (2000 pound avoirdupois).
110     */
111    SHORT_TON( new BigDecimal( "907.18474" ), "to." ),
112
113    /**
114     *  A metric ton.
115     */
116    TON( new BigDecimal( "1000.0" ), "t" );
117
118        /*------------*\
119    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
120        \*------------*/
121    /**
122     *  The factor.
123     */
124    private final BigDecimal m_Factor;
125
126    /**
127     *  The default precision.
128     */
129    private final int m_Precision;
130
131    /**
132     *  The unit string.
133     */
134    private final String m_UnitSymbol;
135
136        /*--------------*\
137    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
138        \*--------------*/
139    /**
140     *  Creates a new {@code Mass} instance with a default precision of zero
141     *  mantissa digits.
142     *
143     *  @param  factor  The factor.
144     *  @param  unitSymbol    The unit string.
145     */
146    private Mass( final BigDecimal factor, final String unitSymbol )
147    {
148        this( factor, unitSymbol, 0 );
149    }   //  Mass()
150
151    /**
152     *  Creates a new {@code Mass} instance.
153     *
154     *  @param  factor  The factor.
155     *  @param  unitSymbol    The unit string.
156     *  @param  precision   The default precision.
157     */
158    private Mass( final BigDecimal factor, final String unitSymbol, final int precision )
159    {
160        m_Factor = factor.stripTrailingZeros();
161        m_UnitSymbol = unitSymbol;
162        m_Precision = precision;
163    }   //  Mass()
164
165        /*---------*\
166    ====** Methods **==========================================================
167        \*---------*/
168    /**
169     *  {@inheritDoc}
170     */
171    @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
172    @Override
173    public final Mass baseUnit() { return KILOGRAM; }
174
175    /**
176     *  {@inheritDoc}
177     */
178    @Override
179    public final BigDecimal factor() { return m_Factor; }
180
181    /**
182     *  Returns the {@code Weight} instance for the given unit.
183     *
184     *  @param  unitSymbol  The unit symbol.
185     *  @return The respective instance.
186     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The given unit is unknown.
187     */
188    public static final Mass forUnit( final String unitSymbol ) throws IllegalArgumentException
189    {
190        requireNotEmptyArgument( unitSymbol, "unitSymbol" );
191
192        final var retValue = stream( values() )
193            .filter( v -> v.unitSymbol().equals( unitSymbol ) )
194            .findFirst()
195            .orElseThrow( () -> new IllegalArgumentException( format( MSG_UnknownUnit, unitSymbol ) ) );
196
197        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
198        return retValue;
199    }   //  forUnit()
200
201    /**
202     *  {@inheritDoc}
203     */
204    @Override
205    public final int getPrecision() { return m_Precision; }
206
207    /**
208     *  {@inheritDoc}
209     */
210    @Override
211    public final String unitSymbol() { return m_UnitSymbol; }
212}
213//  enum Mass
214
215/*
216 *  End of File
217 */
